template: Generate one single-sentence plain-English prompt describing a high-stakes professional task in {regulated_domain} that requires structured analysis, identifying risks or compliance issues, proposing revisions, and delivering both technical and executive summaries; output only the prompt text under 45 words.
filled_prompt: Generate one single-sentence plain-English prompt describing a high-stakes professional task in aircraft maintenance that requires structured analysis, identifying risks or compliance issues, proposing revisions, and delivering both technical and executive summaries; output only the prompt text under 45 words.

message.content: Review a recent aircraft incident report to analyze maintenance procedures, flag compliance gaps, propose revised safety protocols, and prepare both a technical assessment and an executive summary.
message.reasoning_content:
Hmm, the user wants a concise prompt under 45 words for a high-stakes aircraft maintenance task. They need it to cover structured analysis, risk/compliance identification, revisions, and both technical and executive summaries. 

Aircraft maintenance is critical, so the prompt should emphasize safety and compliance. The response must be a single sentence in plain English. 

I can focus on a scenario like revising maintenance protocols after an incident. That naturally requires analysis, risk assessment, and summaries for different audiences. Keeping it under 45 words means trimming unnecessary details while hitting all the required elements. 

The current draft seems to fit: it sets the context (incident review), specifies the actions (analyze, identify, propose), and calls for both technical and executive outputs. Itâ€™s also within the word limit.
